name: soybean production | soybean | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/20469/documentation

This dataset represents the production of 1 kg of Soybean during May-October, 2016 at a farm located in District Indore, Madhya Pradesh State of India. Madhya Pradesh accounts for 57.09% of total soybean production in India during 2015-16. The farm has a yield of 27,500 kg fresh matter per ha for this crop cycle. Sowing date for the crop is 28-May, 2016 and harvesting date is 01-October, 2016. Mineral NPK fertilizer input is 24.6-32.94-24 kg/ha. Organic fertilizer used is solid manure from cattle 12,500 kg/ha. Herbicides used have active ingredients as Imazethapyr 1183.33g/ha (proxy used is Metolachlor), Chlorimuran ethyl 6.25g/ha (proxy used is Alachlor), Quizolofop ethyl 90g/ha, Imazamox 350g/ha. Fungicides used have active ingredients of Carbendazin 945.0g/ha, Mancozeb 409.5g/ha. Insecticides used have active ingredients of Triazophose 275g/ha, Emamectine benzote 12.5g/ha. Machinery is used only for soil cultivation with fuel consumption of 20.8 kg/ha for soil tillage and fuel consumption of 7.8 kg/ha is used for sowing.   

This activity starts about four weeks after the harvest of the previous crop. The soil is prepared for cultivation in first week of May and sowing of seeds started about three weeks after soil preparation. Thereafter the crop is mature for harvesting in about 4 months.

The activity ends with the harvesting of the mature Soybean from the Soybean plant
category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/01:Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities/011:Growing of non-perennial crops/0111:Growing of cereals (except rice), leguminous crops and oil seeds

processDocumentation.timeDescription: Soil cultivating date for the main crop: 06-May, 2016; Harvesting date main crop: 01-October, 2016. The soil cultivation, sowing and harvesting dates are taken as the middle date of the week or fortnight told to the data collector by the farmer. Total time from date of sowing to date of harvesting comes to 115 days.  The data is collected for one crop cycle. The cycle of one year is considered for entry in ecoeditor.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Cultivation of Soybean follows conventional production standards
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: Ecoinvent LCI calculation tool for crop production was used to calculate field emissions from the cultivation process.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: The farmer was identified and contacted by agriculture science faculty familiar with the local farmers in the region. Data was collected directly from the farmer through semi-structured interview using a questionnaire based on the input requirements of the ecoinvent LCI calculation tool for crop production. The farmer does not maintain any written records and has provided the data from recent memory. In this region, typically farmers are unable to provide exact name of active ingredient in the pesticide they use and the same was noted from details given on the pesticide packet. Individual farmer is not able to calculate fuel consumption for his own farm alone and this information has been collected from farming community of the area.

Calculated Value. This value has been calculated by using the ecoinvent LCI calculation tool for crop production.

Total amount of active substance/s of pesticides needed for the production of soybean is calculated to be circa 2.59E-04 kg. Pesticide/s used in this dataset is/are: '[sulfonyl]urea-compound', 'acetamide-anillide-compound, unspecified', 'benzimidazole-compound', 'benzoic-compound', 'diphenylether-compound', 'mancozeb', 'metolachlor', 'organophosphorus-compound, unspecified', 'sulfite'. The total amount of active substance/s is doubled in order to account for the packaging of the dilluted product of pesticide/s that is/are applied. Therefore, 5.18E-04 kg of packaging for pesticides is justified with this exchange.

Fertiliser/s used in this dataset is/are: 'nitrogen fertiliser, as N', 'phosphate fertiliser, as P2O5', 'potassium chloride, as K2O', 'urea, as N'. The total amount of active substance/s is doubled in order to account for the packaging of the dilluted product of fertiliser/s that is/are applied. Therefore, 5.93E-03 kg of packaging for fertilisers is justified with this exchange.
